result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

22CF78 & 22CF378. 1:33 PM Defendant Jose Luis Chavarria appeared by video, in custody-Burnett County Jail.  Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Jose Luis Chavarria.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. CW-clerk. Bonds cont. 1:36 pm adj.

Case Reassignment Order - Br 1 to Br 2
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASES 22CF78 & 22CF378 11:30 AM Defendant Jose Luis Chavarria in court.  Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Jose Luis Chavarria.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. NMG-clerk. Court takes judicial notice of bond 22CF78.  Officer Cusisk S&T. ADA Stilin questions Officer Cusisk. Identification of DE has been made. Cross by Attorney White. Arguments made by Attorney White. ADA Stilin makes arguments. CT finds probable cause and bound over for trial. 

Arraignment: Waived reading. Preservation of prearraignment rights. NG plea entered. adj. 11:46 am

records.addlTxt: BOND to cover cases 22CF378 & 22CF78. Not to possess or use drugs without a prescription or drug paraphernalia. No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed.

CASES: 22CF78 & 22CF378 (IA) 1:06 pm Defendant Jose Luis Chavarria appeared by video from Polk County Jail.  Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Jose Luis Chavarria.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. CH - Clerk 22CF378 - DE has rec'd CC. Atty White waives reading.  CT. quashes warrant in 22CF78. CT. amends 22CF78 bond to cover both cases. State requests bond be amended to cash bond. Atty White request to reinstate signature bond. CT. sets bond. Older case to track 1:16 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
